newsitem.title: USA: FPC Crystal River 3 restart delayed - NRC.
newsitem.headline: FPC Crystal River 3 restart delayed - NRC.

text.p: Restart of Florida Power Corp's (FPC) Crystal River 3 nuclear power unit has been delayed until Sept 26, the Nuclear Regulatory Commission (NRC) said on Thursday.
The NRC, in its Wednesday report, said the 825 megawatt (MW) unit in Red Level, Fla., was slated to start up today.
Crystal River 3 was shut Sept 2 to replace a leaky section of a line that feeds lubrication oil to its turbine shaft.
FPC, a subsidiary of Florida Progress Corp, is the operator and majority owner of Crystal River 3. Ten Florida municipal utilities own the remaining interests in the unit.
